alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 8:58PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New Mexico, including the following county, Chaves. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 855 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms drifting slowly east across northern Chaves County. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen in the Salt Creek watershed along U.S. 285 north of Roswell. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Chaves County - This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 121 and 135, Verbena Road, One Horse Road, Cottonwood Road, Bitter Root Road, and Red Bluff Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
